verses.roman:
ity akrūraṁ samādiśya
bhagavān harir īśvaraḥ
saṅkarṣaṇoddhavābhyāṁ vai
tataḥ sva-bhavanaṁ yayau

synonyms: iti—with these words; akrūram—Akrūra; bhagavan—the Personality of Godhead; hariḥ īśvaraḥ—Lord Hari; saṅkarṣaṇa—with Lord Balarāma; uddhavābhyām—and Uddhava; vai—indeed; tataḥ—then; sva—to His own; bhavanam—residence; yayau—went.
translation: [Śukadeva Gosvāmī continued:] Thus fully instructing Akrūra, the Supreme Personality of Godhead Hari then returned to His residence, accompanied by Lord Saṅkarṣaṇa and Uddhava.
